KnowledgeBase.Title: isChar
KnowledgeBase.ArgumentTypes: Character String Symbol Vector BitVector ByteVector IntVector FltVector ObjVector Structure Dictionary Directory Matrix NumMatrix Integer Float Number Complex
KnowledgeBase.RelatedFunctions: isType isCharAlphabetic isCharAlphanumeric isCharLowercase isCharName isCharNumeric isCharUppercase isCharWhitespace isString isText
KnowledgeBase.HumanKeywords: Character Alphabetic Object Uppercase Lowercase Name Underscore Numeric Alphanumeric Name Whitespace

Function.Description: The isChar function returns true if the argument is a character; otherwise false is returned.

Brief.Overview: The isChar function returns true if the argument {obj} is a character; otherwise false is returned.
Brief.Usage: The isChar function is used to query an object to see if it is of type Character. An alternate method would be to use the isType function.

Argument.Name: obj
Argument.AISTypes: Character, String, Symbol, Vector, BitVector, ByteVector, IntVector, FltVector, ObjVector, Structure, Dictionary, Directory, Matrix, NumMatrix, Integer, Float, Number, Complex

Syntax.Return: If the object is type Character, true is returned. Otherwise false is returned
